refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A stream which compresses data on its input to its output. This is the raw zlib deflated data. See RFCs 1950 and 1951.
We use the implementation in a shared library -lz.

refsect2.title: GskZlibDeflator
refsect2.para: A zlib deflator (compressor) object. One writes raw data to it, and one can read the compressed data from it.

listitem.simpara: milliseconds to wait to flush the buffer or -1 to indicate that flush need only be done at end-of-file.

refsect2.title: gsk_zlib_deflator_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new Zlib deflation stream. This stream is written uncompressed input, and then compressed output can be read back from it.

listitem.simpara: the level of compression to attain in exchange for running slower.
number of milliseconds to wait before flushing all input characters to the output. Use -1 to not set timeouts, which means the buffers are only flushed after a write-shutdown.
